data.title: Your Magical Day Missouri and Kansas Marriage License Information
data.meta_description: Before you have your wedding ceremony you will need to get your Marriage License. Obtain at any area courthouse. In Missouri couple must appear together. In Kansas only one party needs to apply online. Bring this license to our wedding chapel when you come to get married.
data.text:
A MISSOURI marriage license can be purchased at any Missouri courthouse in the state and can be used anywhere in Missouri. Couple must appear together - it does not take long to get and application can even be started online. Apply online for your Missouri marriage license HERE

It is required to have 2 witnesses in Missouri. Marriage Licenses in Missouri cost $50. Some offices require cash (exact amount as they do not make change - Platte County is one) while other counties may also accept credit or debit cards. (We suggest you call the county ahead of time to determine their hours and method of payment required.)

Missouri State Statutes Recorder of Deeds office issues, records and maintains MARRIAGE LICENSE records - NOT marriage CERTIFICATES.

The certificate is just a souvenir for the couple and not a legal document. The courthouse does not have records or copies of the marriage certificate - only the license and the certified copy needed for name change is a certified copy of the LICENSE - not the Certificate.

Individuals must be at least 18 years old to obtain a marriage license; however, with parental consent one can be granted at age 16. No blood test is required and there is no waiting period in Missouri. When you apply for your license, you wait while the information is filled out and you leave with your license in hand.

Both parties must appear together to apply for license;

both must provide social security numbers (no social security card is required) and one piece of identification (Drivers License, Missouri ID, US Passport, Foreign Passport, Military ID, Certified Copy of US Birth Certificate plus US government issued Photo ID or Government ID Card with government ID number.

NO BACKGROUND CHECK IS REQUIRED.

​

What about the Additional $10 Fee to get a CERTIFIED COPY of the Marriage License? Do you Need it?

Yes, if you are in the MILITARY (generally they give this certified copy for FREE to Military) and YES if you intend to use your Marriage License to get a Passport to show your new marital status and are taking your spouse's last name.

You do NOT need to pay this $10 fee for a Certified Copy just to get your last name changed with Social Security. They will accept your ORIGINAL marriage license (the one you bring to us to sign). Social Security Information on name change after marriage HERE.

If either party is divorced or widowed, applicant must provide the month/year

the last marriage ended. A 30 day waiting period is required once a divorce is finalized for an applicant to re-marry. (Jackson County Recorder of Deeds does not enforce this rule and will permit you to purchase a marriage license immediately.)

Once marriage license is issued it is only good for 30 DAYS. Marriage MUST take place within that 30 day time period or license must be returned!

So HURRY UP! Get your license and either walk in or make your appointment with us! Being married is AWESOME!

PRISON, MILITARY, HOSPITAL & ABSENTEE MARRIAGES:

If you can't appear together at the courthouse to purchase your marriage license you will need to fill out the form HERE. It will need to be notarized and also there is a section for the hospital, prison, military, etc. to fill out approving the marriage. Once the absentee party has completed their part, their intended spouse needs to take that form and finish filling it out AT the Recorder of Deeds (offices listed below). The marriage license will then be issued while they are there.

BOTH parties MUST appear together at time of marriage. Proxy marriages are NOT legal in Missouri.

GREEN CARD AFTER MARRIAGE:

Couple will appear together at the Recorder of Deeds to purchase their marriage license providing proof of ID. Once we perform your marriage the marriage license will be filed with the courthouse. They will issue a CERTIFIED copy of it. Take that Certified marriage license to the immigration office. Social security security number and the name change information can be found HERE.

A WORD ABOUT WITNESSES

Missouri State Law Dictates that 2 witnesses must sign the marriage license in order for it to be valid. There is no stipulation of age requirement - CHILDREN may be witnesses. We provide free witnesses if you need them.

RETURNING THE LICENSE

Clay County, and most other counties, mandate that only the wedding officiant may return the marriage license. We will file your license promptly and the counties are very prudent about returning Marriage License to the couple quickly. The ONLY exception they will make for a couple to bring their license in for immediate recording is for MILITARY couples. Please understand when we file for you that we are abiding by State law. JACKSON COUNTY, on the other hand, DOES allow couples to file their own marriage licenses. The advantage in doing so is to get the license back immediately so name changes can be applied for immediately.

​​​If you prefer not to visit a courthouse, the Kansas license process is done completely online and marriage license is emailed. There is a 3 day waiting period.

APPLY ONLINE FOR KANSAS MARRIAGE LICENSE:HERE

​

The Kansas marriage license fee is $85.50 and is applied for ONLINE.

If you go in person, you can pay with cash, money order, cashiers check (made payable to the "Clerk of the District Court") Visa, Mastercard & Discover. They charge a $4.95 convenience fee for credit card payments. NO PERSONAL CHECKS!

Bring photo ID, drivers license, state ID, passport, or birth certificate.

You will also need your social security card.

Under 18 you will need parental permission to get married.

When applying for your marriage license in person, (we recommend applying ONLINE) you will be given an application (worksheet) which you can fill out while you are at the courthouse or you can take it home to fill out later. (obtain at the Clerk of District Court office). Example of the Application Worksheet is HERE.

After 3 business days you may pick it up - again the courthouse and we both suggest applying ONLINE. You will give this to your wedding officiant to sign and file. You will also sign a sworn affidavit which looks like this:

UNIFORM APPLICATION AND AFFIDAVIT FOR MARRIAGE LICENSE

IN THE ____________JUDICIAL DISTRICT DISTRICT COURT

OF ________________COUNTY, KANSAS

STATE OF KANSAS, _________________COUNTY SS:

APPLICATION MADE BY PARTY A PARTY B

Party A Name (Last Name, First Name, Middle Initial) City and County of Residence Age (Please do not list date of birth.)

Party B Name (Last Name, First Name, Middle Initial) City and County of Residence Age (Please do not list date of birth.)

PLEASE READ THE FOLLOWING:

The above-named parties hereby make application to marry and further apply for a marriage license addressed to any person authorized by law to unite said parties in marriage. Affiant, being duly sworn says: That the contracting parties are of lawful age to obtain a marriage license, or have acquired the necessary consent under law if they are not of lawful age. That the contracting parties are not related to each other in any of the degrees prohibited by law, to-wit: Parent and child, grandparent and grandchild in any degree, brother and sister of the whole or half blood, uncle or niece, aunt or nephew, or first cousins. That there is no legal reason preventing such marriage, to the best of the affiant’s knowledge and belief. Party A Signature Party B Signature

SUBSCRIBED AND SWORN TO BEFORE ME THIS DAY OF, 20 .

Name and Title of Court Official

Marriage license is issued after 3 business days. If you apply for your license on Monday it will be issued on Thursday. Tuesday - issued on Friday, etc. (APPLYING ONLINE DOES NOT REQUIRE A VISIT TO THE COURTHOUSE AND WAITING PERIOD IS DONE AT HOME. LICENSE IS ISSUED VIA E-MAIL)

ALL information must be completed when applying for marriage license.

The worksheet must be signed for online - one party can sign for both.

The license is issued and you may have your ceremony performed for a period of six months. Two witnesses are required.

Once ceremony is performed license must be returned within 10 days back to the office where it was purchased (we will file it for you). It will be sent to the Kansas Department of Health & Environment in Topeka, Kansas by the Recorder of Deeds office (either electronically or mailed, depending on the office) and the Certified Copy of the Marriage Certificate will be available for purchase ($20 fee plus shipping) via internet, phone, email or mail. NOTE: Kansas issues a certified marriage CERTIFICATE and not a license. This is what you will need to present to Social Security, etc.

The Department of Health & Environment Website is HERE

If you need a PROXY WEDDING (only one of you can be present) you can get all the information you need for this on our Proxy Marriage website HERE
